Interface java.Nutmeg.CSortable

  Interface java.Nutmeg.CSortable




  
 public interface CSortable
  
 extends Object
  
 extends NCloneable, Sortable


Copyright (c) 1995, 1996 THOUGHT Inc. All Rights Reserved.

Sortable class (an indexable class).

This adds the concept of ordering or sorting to a class object.  If any
Object is to be Ordered or Sorted by the OrderedCollection/SortedCollection
or Dictionary classes, they must be derived from this class.  The CSortable
also addes the concept of Cloneability (It's derived from NCloneable), and
is designed to be used with the DeepCopy method.





  




  
 
	clone()
  
 Clone this collection.
  
 
	compare(Object)
  
 Compare the current object with an object that's passed in to see
if they are equal.





  



compare

  public abstract int compare(Object anObject)




  
 Compare the current object with an object that's passed in to see
if they are equal.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anObject - the object we are comparing with
    
 Returns:
    
 int -1 if less than, 0 if equal and 1 if greater than anObject
  




clone

  public abstract Object clone()




  
 Clone this collection. The objects are not cloned.
  

    
 Returns:
    
 a new Object identical to the current one.
    
 Overrides:
    
 clone in class Object
